content: pattern can be worked without interruption on the next and following rounds repeat rounds 1-7 until you have worked a total of 5 increase rounds work in ls for 12 additional rounds and then work the following 1 ls to last 2 sts ssk k2tog ls to last 2 sts ssk k2tog ls to end repeat this one round decreasing 4 sts each time until there are a total of 11 sts remaining 3 5 3 cut yarn thread through a darning needle remove dpns and thread yarn through remaining live sts pull tightly closed and secure ears make 2 co 4 sts onto 1 dpn and work the following row 1 p 2 k repeat these two row one more time then cast off on the purl side you will have knit a little square using the long tail from the cast on and a darning needle reinforce the outside edges by stitching around them this will also round them a bit fold to create a hollowing and seam to beaver s head back legs make 2 co 12 sts onto 3 dpns 4 4 4 and knit all sts for 1 ½ inch then work the following rounds 1 k1 k2tog k1 repeat each dpn knit all sts for an additional 1 ½ inches 2 k1 kfb k1 repeat each dpn 3 k1 kfb k2 repeat each dpn 4-5 k all sts divide all sts onto 2 needles 7 on one and 8 on the other 6 ssk k to last 2 sts on needle k2tog ssk k to last 2 sts on needle k2tog repeat row 6 until 2 sts remain on each needle the needle which had 7 sts will end in a k1 instead of a k2tog k all 4 sts one more time cut yarn and thread it into a darning needle remove dpns and thread through live sts pull tightly closed and secure stuff seam to bottom of beaver about 4 inches from tail 4 front legs make 2 co 9 sts onto 3 dpns 3 3 3 and knit all sts for 1 inch then work the following rounds 1 k2tog k1 repeat each dpn knit all sts for an additional 1 inch cut yarn and thread it into a darning needle remove dpns and thread through live sts pull tightly closed and secure stuff seam to beaver s body embroider eyes nose and teeth or use other embellishments as desired hug and love 5
